metadata.scene_name: Collision between Blocks on a Frictional Surface - Variation 1
metadata.task: Determine how friction alters the collision outcome between two blocks.

answer: Rebound velocity is reduced due to friction.
expected_behavior: Friction from the surface slows the blocks after collision, reducing rebound velocity differently based on surface contact.
reasoning: Friction dissipates kinetic energy; uneven friction leads to asymmetric deceleration.
